comment: If you're starting out in programming, this is exactly the kind of professor you want to take. The examples and information provided in his lectures are wonderful and will help you easily grasp the course concepts. He's very accessible and responds in a timely manner. His lectures are the best, and he's very understanding about circumstances.

Professor Forsyth is a chill dude. Entertaining lectures and real passion for the subject material. It's tough to keep me interested at 9 am but he always managed to do it. Not a tough grader and very understanding.

Professor Forsyth is a nice and reasonable professor. His assignments are straightforward and allows you to use outside resources on exams and lab assignments. Attendance is not mandatory and he has learning modules and coding exercises posted on D2L. The only strict policy he enforces is that assignments are submitted on time.

Awesome professor. Very funny with lots of sarcasm but he definitely cares about his students. If you are struggling with anything in the course, he is available and makes time to help you and make sure you understand the material. Grades very fair and criteria is clear. Only homework is a simple weekly discussion question along with the lab.

Took this professor for the lecture and the lab. The lecture was very easy. Tests were easy and we only had one discussion due weekly with no minimum word requirement. The lab was a bit more challenging since I have no prior experience to coding but I have learned lots of things and it takes practice and time.

I have taken Professor Forsyth in the past and loved him. Work is due every other week (quizzes, assignments, discussion posts). This class involves a lot of research and written responses, but it is very easy if you manage your time right. There is a group project (8-11 page paper) but as long as you meet the 5 things he looks for it's an easy A.

Took IT 1114 lecture and it was very simple and straightfoward. Lecture videos every week with worked-out coding examples to help with the IT 1114 Lab. Weekly discussion posts were very simple. 3 exams made up of 2 parts. Part 1 was 12-15 multiple-choice questions. Part 2 was a lab assignment coding. Responds to emails very quick. Amazing prof

This is the best professor at KSU. Lectures were not mandatory but I recommend going anyway because he makes them interesting. He has a great speaking voice and clearly knows what he's talking about. If he is an option for any class, especially in-person, take him. Prof Forsyth absolutely deserves his good RMP rating.

Professor William is Amazing. He explains things very well. His class is just discussion boards and exams. They are not to bad. I wish I had him before I start my programming class. I have learned a lot and he motivated you to be confident at your own work. Take him if this is your first time taking coding class. He is your guy!!!

I took his 1114 lecture & lab. Very clear with expectations and the content is easy to understand but, within the lecture class, supplemented basic lecturing with examples so we could see what the code was actually doing. Stay ontop of due dated for weekly discussion boards and you'll do great. Had office hours, time after class, and easy to reach.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: This is my second taking this professor and I have no complaints. Pretty clear assignment schedule: every two weeks you work on a discussion, quiz, and assignment about the chapter. Most things are straightforward when it comes to the class, great professor if you have the choice.

very easy class, I took 1114 Python Lab and Lecture. I finished the class two weeks early because it was so easy. If you need to take python He is also pretty helpful helping you understand the concepts that you do not understand all you have to do is ask for help. Participation does not matter but I say you go anyway for your success. I Got an A+
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Very easy class, nice professor. Class consists of 3 exams and 13 discussions. Easy grader.

If you are trying to decide which professor to pick, Mr.Forsyth is the best for IT1114 and the lab portion. He is great with his lectures and has weekly discussions; if you take his lab portion, it has a coding lab each week. I took his class online and he doesn't grade harshly at all, he is very understanding. Test, no lockdown, no webcam.

This class was the definition of "show up and pass". Labs told you exactly what to do, you just had to take a few screenshots. Other than that, there were a few discussions and tests. Forsyth is one of the best teachers in the CCSE department at KSU, but this class was underwhelming and almost too easy. Easy A, but nothing memorable.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: This professor is like 1 of 5 that actually know something in the IT department. He teaches really good and all the work in the class is fairly easy to follow. The semester project looks intimidating but as long as you attempt it you will get a decent grade. Highly reccomend

Book is cheap like $10/free. I took java at another school b4 this so was an easy class for me. Does some good hands on practice in class and gets you to think. Interacts with class. Good exposure to Python. I wish GSU had this class w/ a teacher like forsyth because it would've made adv programming classes easy. He really cares. it's a good intro

You can find the book online so do not buy. Use it to do the discussions. discussion don't have number of words requirements so write a good paragraph and ur good! Three Tests all online no lockdown or webcam! use your resources. python 6 labs and the tests are two parts each, one is multiple choice and the other is a code (do like labs).

Prof. Forsyth is such a great professor. He is very open to helping you and will stay after class. He uses real world approaches and lets you use resources for the lab activities. His lectures are interactive and he makes them so entertaining.

By far the best IT professor out there. He lines out everything that you will need for the class, provides videos for each lecture (which is fantastic as I took this class online), cuts out the unnecessary busy work, and is very accessible outside of class. He made this class very doable, even for a difficult class that is Unix/Linux.

Professor Forsyth really knows the topics that he is teaching does a great job in explaining things in a way that you can understand and applied them in the real world. He cares about his students and is really knowledgeable.

Best programming prof ever especially for beginners. I have been out of school for a while but he made me understand all the new concepts. I took the adv course but he started from scratch. He is very patient, understanding & thorough. Labs, exams & grading are well explained. If you are serious, you will A's his class and actually learn something.

Professor Forsyth does not intend for this course to serve an intensive introduction to programming (that would be CSE 1321, etc). This course is however great for someone looking for enough programming knowledge to serve as a background for another application (I.E. GIS/RS).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Such a great professor! I had a hard time with some basic concepts with programming at first, I went to him and he sat down and explained it to me until I got it for another 2 HOURS after class was finished!! He is very laid back and funny and you can obviously tell he is very passionate about programming which is awesome to experience!

By far the best programming professor that I have had. He encourages class input, is a kind professor, gives great feedback, and is accessible outside of class. He also gives all the modules/assignments out at the beginning of the semester so you can come prepared to class. Class has 14 modules, 14 quizzes, 2 exams, and a final. Would take again!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is fairly new in his career of teaching but don't let that deter you from taking him. Records his lectures and made every one of them very interesting and easy to understand. Very energetic and a very flexible grader as well. Take him if you actually want to learn something while not sacrificing your grade.

Well bieng as though I had to take this class as a add on to the program after having took more advanced programming classes, this class was a breeze. I scored 100's on just about every assigmnet except for 3 assignments. He records his lectures and places them online for his online classes.
rating_tags: Tests? Not many--Amazing lectures--Would take again
